{{also|Zehn}} ==Central Franconian== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|gmw-cfr|ziehn||southern Moselle Franconian}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|gmw-cfr|goh|zehan}}, from {{inh|gmw-cfr|gem-pro|*tehun|t=ten}}, from {{inh|gmw-cfr|ine-pro|*dÃ©á¸±mÌ¥|t=ten}}. The vocalic development is comparable to that in {{m|gmw-cfr|sehn||to see}}, i.e. Old High German ''-eha-'' was contracted and merged with ''-ia-'' (see the same in {{cog|nl|tien}}, {{m|nl|zien}}). ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|gmw-cfr|/tseËn/}} ===Numeral=== {{head|gmw-cfr|numeral}} # {{lb|gmw-cfr|Ripuarian|northern|_|Moselle Franconian}} [[ten]] ---- ==German== {{cardinalbox|de|9|10|11|neun|elf|ord=zehnte}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|goh|zehan}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*tehun|t=ten}}, from {{inh|de|ine-pro|*dÃ©á¸±mÌ¥|t=ten}}. Compare {{cog|nl|tien}}, {{cog|en|ten}}, {{cog|got|ğ„ğŒ°ğŒ¹ğŒ·ğŒ¿ğŒ½}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/tseËn/}} * {{audio|de|De-zehn.ogg|audio}} * {{rhymes|de|eËn}} ===Numeral=== {{head|de|numeral}} # {{cln|de|cardinal numbers}} [[ten]] {{gloss|numerical value represented in Arabic numerals as 10}} ====Coordinate terms==== {{de-cardinal}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Zehn}} ====Related terms==== {{rel4 |de|obere Zehntausend |{{l|de|dreizehn|t=thirteen}} |{{l|de|vierzehn|t=fourteen}} |{{l|de|fÃ¼nfzehn|t=fifteen}} |{{l|de|sechzehn|t=sixteen}} |{{l|de|siebzehn|t=seventeen}} |{{l|de|achtzehn|t=eighteen}} |{{l|de|neunzehn|t=nineteen}} }} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Hunsrik== {{cardinalbox|hrx|9|10|11|nein|ellef|ord=zehnt}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|hrx|/tÍ¡seËn/}} ===Numeral=== {{head|hrx|numeral}} # {{cln|hrx|cardinal numbers}} [[ten]] #: {{ux|hrx|Mein Dochter is '''zehn''' Joher alt.|My daughter is '''ten''' years old.}} ===Further reading=== * [https://hunsriqueanoriograndense.wordpress.com/dicionario-werterbuch/ Online Hunsrik Dictionary]
